name: Neck Tilt Stretch
description: Gently stretches the side neck muscles to relieve tension from computer work.
instructions: Sit up straight with shoulders relaxed.
Slowly tilt your head toward your right shoulder.
Use your right hand to gently apply additional pressure.
Hold for 10 seconds, then repeat on the left side.

name: Chin Tucks
description: Targets the deep neck flexors and helps correct forward head posture.
instructions: Sit or stand with a neutral spine.
Keep your eyes forward and pull your chin straight back.
Create a "double chin" without tilting your head down.
Hold for 5 seconds, release, and repeat 3 times.

name: Shoulder Shrugs
description: Releases tension in the upper trapezius muscles from prolonged sitting.
instructions: Sit or stand with arms relaxed at your sides.
Lift both shoulders up toward your ears.
Hold the shrug at the top for 3 seconds.
Release and lower shoulders completely. Repeat 5 times.

name: Shoulder Blade Squeeze
description: Stretches muscles between the shoulder blades to counter hunched posture.
instructions: Sit up straight with arms at your sides.
Pull your shoulder blades together behind you.
Imagine holding a pencil between your shoulder blades.
Hold for 5 seconds, then release slowly. Repeat 5 times.

name: Overhead Reach
description: Stretches the shoulders, lats, and sides of the torso.
instructions: Sit or stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Interlace your fingers and extend arms overhead.
Push your palms toward the ceiling.
Lean gently to the right, hold, then lean to the left.

name: Wrist Flexor Stretch
description: Stretches the underside forearm muscles to prevent strain from typing.
instructions: Extend your right arm forward, palm facing up.
Use your left hand to gently pull your fingers back toward you.
Keep your arm straight and feel the stretch in your forearm.
Hold, then switch arms.

name: Wrist Extensor Stretch
description: Stretches the top forearm muscles to relieve tension from mouse use.
instructions: Extend your right arm forward, palm facing down.
Use your left hand to gently press your fingers toward the floor.
Keep your arm straight and feel the stretch on top of your forearm.
Hold, then switch arms.

name: Seated Spinal Twist
description: Mobilizes the thoracic spine and relieves mid-back tension from sitting.
instructions: Sit up straight with feet flat on the floor.
Place your right hand on the back of your chair.
Rotate your torso to the right, looking over your shoulder.
Hold, then repeat on the left side.

name: Seated Cat-Cow
description: Mobilizes the entire spine and relieves stiffness from prolonged sitting.
instructions: Sit on the edge of your chair with hands on your knees.
Arch your back, lifting your chest and looking up (cow).
Round your spine, tucking your chin to your chest (cat).
Alternate slowly between the two positions for the full duration.

name: Chest Opener
description: Stretches the pectoral muscles that tighten from keyboard and mouse work.
instructions: Stand up and clasp your hands behind your back.
Straighten your arms and gently lift them.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together and open your chest.
Hold and breathe deeply.

name: Seated Hip Flexor Stretch
description: Stretches the hip flexors that shorten from prolonged sitting.
instructions: Scoot to the edge of your chair.
Extend your right leg back with toes on the ground.
Keep your left foot flat and knee at 90 degrees.
Tilt your pelvis slightly forward to deepen the stretch. Switch sides.

name: Standing Quad Stretch
description: Stretches the front thigh muscles to improve circulation after sitting.
instructions: Stand next to your desk for support.
Bend your right knee and grab your ankle behind you.
Pull your heel toward your glutes, keeping knees together.
Hold, then switch legs.

name: Child's Pose
description: Gently stretches the lower back, hips, and shoulders while promoting relaxation.
instructions: Kneel on the floor and sit back on your heels.
Fold forward, extending your arms out in front of you.
Rest your forehead on the mat.
Breathe deeply and relax into the stretch.

name: Cat-Cow Pose
description: Mobilizes the entire spine and relieves back stiffness from sitting.
instructions: Start on hands and knees in a tabletop position.
Arch your back, lifting your chest and tailbone (cow).
Round your spine, tucking chin and tailbone (cat).
Flow slowly between positions with your breath.

name: Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
description: Deeply stretches the hip flexors that become chronically tight from desk work.
instructions: Kneel on your right knee with your left foot forward at 90 degrees.
Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
Shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the right hip.
Hold, then switch sides.

name: Modified Pigeon Pose
description: Opens the hips and glutes to relieve lower back pain from sitting.
instructions: From tabletop, bring your right knee forward behind your right wrist.
Extend your left leg straight back behind you.
Lower your hips toward the floor.
Fold forward over your front leg for a deeper stretch. Switch sides.

name: Cobra Stretch
description: Extends the spine and opens the chest to counter rounded posture.
instructions: Lie face-down with your hands under your shoulders.
Press into your hands to lift your chest off the floor.
Keep your hips on the ground and shoulders relaxed.
Look forward or slightly up, breathing deeply.

name: Supine Figure-4 Stretch
description: Stretches the glutes and piriformis to relieve hip and lower back tension.
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor.
Cross your right ankle over your left knee.
Thread your hands through and clasp behind your left thigh.
Pull your left thigh toward your chest. Hold, then switch sides.
